statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Wake Forest 72, Richmond 59
article.story: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C. (AP) -- L.D. Williams scored a career-high 16 points as Wake Forest overcame its lowest-scoring half of the season to beat Richmond 72-59 on Friday night. Williams scored 14 points in the second half as the Demon Deacons (7-4) rallied from a 13-point halftime deficit to win their second straight game. Kyle Visser added 17 points and Ish Smith 13 for Wake Forest, which led by as many as seven points early in the first half before going cold, hitting just 1-of-10 from the field in the last 12:33. Dan Geriot came off the bench to score 21 points for the Spiders (4-6), including 13 in the first half as Richmond took advantage of the Demon Deacons' shooting problems to lead 35-22 at the break. But Wake Forest shot 62.5 percent in the second half and turned 14 Spiders turnovers into 28 points. Visser scored 10 straight points in a 19-8 run that cut Richmond's lead to 43-41 with 13:51 left, then Williams nailed a 3-pointer that gave the Demon Deacons their first lead since midway through the first half. Geriot responded with a layup to put the Spiders back on top, but Williams then followed his own miss for a layup to put Wake Forest in the lead for good. The Demon Deacons put the game away in the closing minutes of the second half, using a 13-1 run to pull ahead 68-50 with 2:25 remaining for their biggest lead of the game. David Gonzalvez added 12 points for the Spiders, who suffered their third straight loss.
